item.title: Nigeria's teen tech wonder
item.description: Joshua Agboola has been programming since he was 6 and today, as a teenager, even teaches other kids to code. The tech prodigy not only spreads knowledge, but also protects others: One of Joshuas's focuses is on how to protect children from malicious content online.
item.keywords: DWVC,Nigeria, Africa, early programming, child programmer, coding education, youth mentorship, tech prodigy, knowledge sharing, child safety online, internet safety, cybersecurity, online protection
item.media:title: Nigeria's teen tech wonder
item.media:keywords: DWVC,Nigeria, Africa, early programming, child programmer, coding education, youth mentorship, tech prodigy, knowledge sharing, child safety online, internet safety, cybersecurity, online protection

item.title: Uganda's new anti-gay law
item.description: 10 years in prison for identifying as LGBTQ, five for promoting homosexuality â€” Uganda's parliament has passed tough new penalties for same-sex relations. @DW
item.keywords: DWVC,Uganda, homophobia, LGBTQI+, homosexuality, anti-gay law
item.media:title: Uganda's new anti-gay law
item.media:keywords: DWVC,Uganda, homophobia, LGBTQI+, homosexuality, anti-gay law

item.title: India's first transgender parents
item.description: A couple in Kerala, Ziya and Zahad, have given the transgender community new hope. In order to give birth to a child, Zahad had temporarily stopped his transition and became pregnant and now this couple are parents to a child. This is accepted practice elsewhere in the world but it is believed to be unprecedented in India.
item.keywords: DWVC,India, transgender, parents, LGTBQI+, Kerala, child
item.media:title: India's first transgender parents
item.media:keywords: DWVC,India, transgender, parents, LGTBQI+, Kerala, child

item.title: Brazil stops Amazon drilling
item.description: Brazil's oil company, Petrobras, is one of the largest in the world, and they have their sights set on the Amazon. But the new government is delaying the plans.
item.keywords: DWVC,Brazil, amazon, oil drilling, government, President Lula, Petrobas
item.media:title: Brazil stops Amazon drilling
item.media:keywords: DWVC,Brazil, amazon, oil drilling, government, President Lula, Petrobas

item.title: Italy migrant boat disaster causes outrage
item.description: A deadly shipwreck off the coast of Italy is raising questions about the future of European migration and asylum policy.
item.keywords: DWVC,boat, migrant, European migration, italy, disaster
item.media:title: Italy migrant boat disaster causes outrage

item.title: IPCC Report sounds alarming but offers hope
item.description: The lastest IPCC report is a stark reminder that time is running out to change course. But it also confirms that tools are available to limit global warming and effects of climate change.
item.keywords: DWVC,IPCC Report, Climate Change, Global Warming, Environment
item.media:title: IPCC Report sounds alarming but offers hope
item.media:keywords: DWVC,IPCC Report, Climate Change, Global Warming, Environment

item.title: Syria's school system devastated by quake
item.description: 60 out of 86 schools in the region hit by the February 6 earthquake sustained damage. With no concrete repair plans by the international community, repair efforts are severely limited Ã¢â‚¬â€ and the situation is disastrous for Syria's schoolchildren.
item.keywords: DWVC,Syria, school, education, earthquake, UNICEF, student

item.title: Clean energy: the global race for raw materials
item.description: Europe's green energy transition is dependent on China's supply of the raw materials needed to power wind turbines, electric cars and other green technologies.
item.keywords: DWVC,Clean energy, EU, China, raw materials, Lithium, green technology, electric cars, environment
item.media:title: Clean energy: the global race for raw materials
item.media:keywords: DWVC,Clean energy, EU, China, raw materials, Lithium, green technology, electric cars, environment

item.title: Mice with two biological dads
item.description: Japanese scientists say they have created mice with two biological fathers, by turning male mouse skin cells into female egg cells. This technology is still very new. But in the future, it could lead to whole new possibilities in reproductive medicine.
item.keywords: DWVC,Science, Japan, mice, technology, reproductive medicine
item.media:title: Mice with two biological dads
item.media:keywords: DWVC,Science, Japan, mice, technology, reproductive medicine

item.title: Are you scared of getting Alzheimer's? AI might be able to help!
item.description: Alzheimer's is still untreatable, but early detection can slow it down. US researchers used AI to discover a predisposition for the disease during routine checks.
item.keywords: DWVC,Alzheimer's disease, Artificial Intelligence, Technology, Science, US research, early detection
item.media:title: Are you scared of getting Alzheimer's? AI might be able to help!
item.media:keywords: DWVC,Alzheimer's disease, Artificial Intelligence, Technology, Science, US research, early detection
